雅京特区政府宣布2020年最低工资为427万盾

02 Nov 2019, 03:24

【安达拉通讯社雅加达11月1日讯】雅京特区政府（Pemprov DKI）省长阿尼斯（Anies Baswedan），周五（11月1日）在雅京正式公布2020年雅京最低工资（UMP）设定为427万6349盾，同比增长8.51％或比2019年调升33万5776盾。阿尼斯说，2020年雅京特区最低工资的调高是根据现行的雅京特区和政府的法规。劳工部长哈尼夫达基里（Hanif Dhakiri）于2019年10月15日发函给全国各地方首长关于通货膨胀率和2019年国内生产总值（GDP）增长数据。其中劳工部长在第九条内容解释说，截至2019年9月，全国通货膨胀率为3.39％，而国内生产总值增长5.12％。根据2015年关于最低工资的政府条规PP第78号第44条第1款和第2款的规定，最低工资增加基于是根据国内生产总值和通胀率作为计算参数。雅京特区也是根据上述这两个参数作为依据，将雅京特区2020年的每个月最低工资定为427万6349盾，与2019年最低工资每月394万973盾调高33万5376盾，相比增加8.51％。阿尼斯如是解释。根据2015年政府条例PP第78号第44条第1款和第2款，2020年最低工资是亦2019年最低工资乘以通货膨胀率再加上国内生产总值增长得出的结果。阿尼斯补充说。（v）

The Yajing SAR government announced that the minimum wage for 2020 is 4.27 million rupiah

02 Nov 2019, 03:24

[Andara News Agency, Jakarta, November 1] Angie Baswedan, governor of the Pemprov DKI, officially announced the 2020 Yajing Minimum Wage (UMP) at Yajing on Friday (November 1) It was set at 4.27 million 6349 rupiah, an increase of 8.51% over the same period of last year or 335,776 rupiah over 2019. Anis said that the 2020 minimum salary increase in the Yajing SAR is based on the current Yajing SAR and government regulations. On October 15, 2019, the Minister of Labor, Hanif Dhakiri, sent a letter to local heads of state on inflation and 2019 gross domestic product (GDP) growth. The Minister of Labor explained in Article 9 that as of September 2019, the national inflation rate was 3.39%, while the GDP grew by 5.12%. According to the provisions of Article 34, paragraphs 1 and 2, of the 2015 Government Regulations on Minimum Wage PP No. 78, the minimum wage increase is based on the calculation of GDP and inflation rate. Based on the above two parameters, the Yajing Special Zone has set the minimum monthly salary of the Yajing Special Zone in 2020 to 4.27 million and 349 guilders, and the minimum wage of 2019 to 394,973 guilders per month to increase by 334,376 rupees. Compared with an increase of 8.51%. Anis explained. According to Article 44, paragraphs 1 and 2, of the Government Regulations PP No. 78 of 2015, the minimum wage for 2020 is the result of the 2019 minimum wage multiplied by the inflation rate plus GDP growth. Anis added. (v)
